forum.name: updates
forum.description: find out what's new with anylad. feature announcements and bug fix info. thanks all!
forum.latestCommentText: im gonna miss it for sure

thread.title: New: Dynamic Hands!

comments.text: Hi all! Today's v166.1 (you're on [version]) features a new dynamic hand. Thx Kool, Jinx, all!
The goal was to better visualize trigger click vs hand grab (in preparation for Knuckles & to optimize outstanding issues for past devices) while keeping the finger dot precision.
When triggering, index finger & thumb form a tweezer pose, while the finger dot (+ muscle memory) remains as is. Oculus & Knuckles also show separate grip part motions.
Different objects turn into slightly different grab poses, so give grabbing e.g. a non-triggerable sword vs a triggerable gun a try.
Feedback welcome, pls let me know which device you have (and if anyone after a while wants an option to go back to the old static hand, let me know, it would be easy to add).
the unreal feeling of your hand sliding away is painful imo. please, have a way to disable this or have it so neither the palm or ring moves.
i would much rather my index finger and others move towards my hand. this is really asswards back. i pull my index finger towards my body to grab things. the visual should not be..
the rest of my hand sliding away.
i like hand animations but this realllly really doesnt work. id like to turn it off or have a version where my hand is static and the fingers move...
i also agree, the ring moving and the hand just makes my skin crawl, id muc rather prefer the old static hand but with a experimental moving hand mode <3
Update 167.2: You can now disable dynamic hands in the Me More settings! This way, you can keep experimenting with this new mode while we tune it based on your feedback.
E.g. maybe we find a way to keep most of the dynamic features, while improving on the trigger causing hand movement. Thx Nic, Xau, Saf, all!
Also, we fixed the issue with leg movement making the ring button stop working! Thx Dr. Tangerine!
i like that the hands are now animated but agree with a couple of the others that having them move in relation to the controllers feels off.
having it stay where it is but doing the animations seems like a good middle ground imo :)
yeah! all it really needs is the same kind of treatment as custom hands.
zid, we'd have done that, but then the dot (per real hands tweeze logic) is somewhere else, lower.. so you can't move your tip into things anymore to precision-preview-buzz them...
... and button tapping vs finger dragging would now have different points... but yeah, maybe there's a solution to be found somewhere there! maybe 2 points...
... one for button pressing, and one for dragging/ selecting, just above the thumb, so that it would then be the new preview-buzz point :)

thread.latestCommentText: ... just above the thumb, so that it would then be the new preview-buzz point :)
